(10/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate bitter. (9/10) Palate: full body, soft carbonation, dry bitter finish. (5/5)

Barrel aged coffee? To quote Cartman, that whole concept has warped my fragile little mind, and may well necessitate a fundamental change to breakfast as I know it. (Apparently they sell the coffee through their web site? Ordered!) Huge coffee notes dominate over dark chocolate and oaky bourbon, but neither come across as harsh or overwhelming. Visually impressive, this thing is as utterly black as a politicians heart, with no relief at all around the margins. (The label claims 45 SRM, and I believe it. I thought the Standard Reference Method scale topped out at 40, but this is definitely the inkiest black brew Ive ever seen.) And yet, surprisingly smooth and mild, with very restrained bitterness. Do what you gotta do to lay hands on this. Its better to get forgiveness than permission. (18/20)

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 I have heard about a new trend of using coffee beans aged in wooden barrels and this allegedly was the first one to do that, curious about this. Medium thick, moussy, pale beige, stable head, well retaining around the edge, black robe with hazy burgundy edges. Refined bouquet of real coffee beans and coffee powder, espresso, liquorish, bitter chocolate, sugared black tea, hazelnut paste, aniseed, bayleaf, cigars, dry leather, cinnamon rolls, vanilla beans, light bourbon, dried thyme. Clean fruity onset, hints of dried fig and unripe pear, touch of leathery umami and some dim elderberry sourishness, softish carbo, pleasantly oily and creamy, slick mouthfeel. Very nutty malt body with a bitterish toasted edge, blending beautifully with the uplifting notes of high quality coffee powder towards the finish without turning deeply roasted bitter, some spicy hops way back but not outspoken (unsurprisingly at only 30 IBU), leathery and teaish accents, dryish, with the coffee lingering alongside a bitter chocolatey end maltiness and a dash of warming, well-positioned alcohol. I do not quite get barrel ageing here - if only the added coffee and not the beer itself has aged on bourbon barrels, this effect can only be subtle - so I am left wondering a bit what the point of this novelty is, but in general this is a very well-balanced, refined, highly drinkable and beautiful stout without any flaws. Recommended.

Lite spritiga bourbontoner anas i bakgrunden tillsammans med lakrits, kola, choklad och nötiga inslag. En åtminstone i början riktigt stor, fyllig och len kropp som dock tunnas ut snabbt i avslutningen. Stor kaffe- och espressoton i förgrunden även vad gäller smaken. Ganska kärvt rostad med inslag av lite fruktig chili, lakrits, chilichoklad och pumpernickel. Bourbontonerna mer i bakgrunden smakmässigt, vilket gör sig bra. Kaffet och det som drar åt fruktig chili med en lätt hetta ligger kvar i munnen länge. Riktigt gott, hade gärna druckit en flaska själv.

Monks.
Bachelorette partys 
Dark black, white head
Aroma of coffee roast tones 
Quite thin
Nice

Dark brown color, medium brown head. Roasted aromas, chocolate milk with coffee lingering in the background. Heavy coffee taste without getting too bitter. Swee tastes of chocolate and cream. Slight bitter finish with the taste of roasted coffe returning to neatly tie up the bag.

Bottled:Pours black with ruby highlights. Medium head.Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and a little bit of biscuits.Taste is coffee, slight bourbon, kiwi (!) and chocolate leading to a warming finish.

Bottle from SB. Bomber. Nice black color. Beige head. Chocolate, lots of it. Coffee, a bit roasted, a bit of liquor ice, leather. Medium sweet, lots of coffee, chocolate, vanilla flavors. Started drinking cold, gets better when its warming up. Nice beer, very beautifully balanced.

Very dark brown, almost black colour. Beige head. Aroma of coffee, a bit of vanilla, roasted malts, cocoa beans. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Medium body, slick to oily texture, soft carbonation. Very coffeey.
Flaska beställd från SB. Svart med beige skum. Doft av kaffesump. Smak av kaffe med mjölk.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Bottle @home. Pitch black with a rather large creamy beige head. Loads of espresso coffee, vanilla, oak and of course bourbon. Taste is smooth with a lot of coffee. Very good beer.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured black color with an average frothy tan head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex roasted malt and wood, coffee aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth dry texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted coffee sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where surpassed.

Bottle. It pours pitch black with a creamy beige head. Chocolate, roast, ground coffee and oak in the nose. The flavor is medium roasted with coffee and bourbon notes. Chocolate and toffee. Easy drinking and very tasty.

Black, ivory head, sticky. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, toffee, malt. Taste is similar in its creamed coffee, cacao, vanilla and toffee/caramel mix. Mouthfeel is nice and chewy. If more of the oaky bourbon could've shown through from the beans it could've been amazing. Still very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Aroma of sweet coffee, vanilla, cream, soft roast. 
Pours almost pitch black with a small beige, but lasting head. 
Taste is pretty balanced between a medium sweetness and bitterness. Taste follows the nose but also with a slight honey tone. 
Medium body, silky mouthfeel, soft carbonation, roasted coffee and vanilla finish. This is great and very drinkable.

CBC 2016 Green session. Very dark brown body with a beige head. Aroma of bourbon and coffee, chocolate, mild smoke. Taste is strong coffee, oak, light earthy hops, solid bitterness, complex bourbon and coffee finish. Quite nice!

Draft. Pours near black with a tan head. A ton of rich and sweet mocha coffee, milder roasted notes, vanilla, and lighter bourbon. Doesnt finish overly sweet, despite how rich it is, and maintains a good level of drinkability, even through a full pour. Awesome.

Rating #1700 - 2015.05.31 - Bottle treat from SD opened in a dingy Saskatoon hotelroom - Pours a rich dark black, head retention difficult to gauge with unfortunate hotel "glassware". Aroma is bourbon vanilla, espresso, wildflower honey. All of those wonderful Imperial notes of a BA beer from the BA coffee, really mellow and subdued because the alcohol is low in comparison. A wondrous brew.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel, coffee and chocolate.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel, chocolate and coffee.
Roasted finish.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours a stout brown with a tan head. Nose is wood, green coffee, peanut butter, earth, and some bakers chocolate. Flavor is similar with bakers chocolate, peanut butter, green coffee, roast, oak, and some licorice. Like able beer, but coffee flavor comes off as peanut.

Draft at the source on 7/1/2016. Color is dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and dark malts. Taste is coffee, roasted malts, chocolate notes, faint vanilla. Not picking up any bourbon, however. Roasty finish.

Tap
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, chocolate, sweet, licorice, coffee.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are lots of bitter coffee, chocolate, and roasted malts.

1 pt 6 fl oz bottle. Black-brown colour, beige foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of roast malt, smoke, chocolate & coffee. Taste is malt, ash, roasted, dark fruits, chocolate, coffee, caramel with some light bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roast bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.

Negro con reflejos rojizos y espuma beis. Aromas de café y ligero chocolate. Cuerpo medio-bajo, sabor como aroma y final de amargor acafetado suave.

CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and strong coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, strong coffee, liquorice, medium sweet, espresso and medium bitter.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours hazy brown with a tan head, light lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, rich coffee, dark chocolate, wood, light bourbon. Flavor is light sweet, malty, caramel, rich coffee, dark chocolate, light vanilla, light bourbon. Medium body, average carbonation. 140516

Taps coffee brown that lets a peep of mahogany light through at the bottom and features a thick, fine-bubbled tan head. Quality coffee dominates the aroma but shares the stage with roast malt, fresh-cut wood, chocolate and molasses notes. Flavor offers coffee, chocolate, roast malt and woody tones. Barrel-aged coffee beans must be the reason for the distinctive taste. Mouthfeel delivers firm, viscous body and strong fizz. Nothing dead about this one!

Draught at BierCraft Wesbrook, VancouverBlack color. Creamy beige head. Strange aroma, a bit ashy and a bit vinous, maybe sour. Dry mouthfeel, the sourness from the dark malts seems high, or maybe its a contribution from the barrel; red wine and coffee, not a harmonious combination.Not a bad beer, but

Draught @ CBC 2016, Green session, København
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, alcohol and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, chocolate, caramel and coffee finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Pour is a thick black with a retaining quarter inch tan head. Looks like obsidian. smell is nice and mild, rainwater, coffee, slight spice. Taste is also nice and mild, balanced coffee, a mild nuttiness, an interesting floral quality(?) Long residual cold brewed coffee aftertaste

On tap. Pours black with moderate head. Aromas of dark fruit, dark sugar, wood and toasted malts. Flavors of woody liquor, wet malts, and stale coffee with some vegetal notes (which I dont think should be there...). Maybe not the best sample... Need to try again.

On tap at BierCraft UBC, pours a deep dark mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma brings out espresso beans, light bourbon and a little harsh booze. Flavour is complex as hell, with loads of bourbon, vanilla beans and espresso beans. Complex, despite being medium-bodied. Fantastic.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 On tap at BierCraft with Jamey and Brad. Pours very dark black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, grassy, slightly smoky. Taste is sweet, coffee notes, grassy. Hoppy bitter, roasted malt aftertaste. Veeery good!

Keg at BD Mighty Boosh, 09/06/16.
Pitch black with a well appointed tan head that retains well.
Nose is coffee grinds, chocolate, light roast, toffee fudge.
Taste comprises chocolate brownies, earthy coffee, light spice, charr, brown sugar, molasses. 
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close. 
Solid stout ... great coffee bean presence ... Top draw.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Crazy big sample at OBC, Ojai. Pours like dark coffee with a tan head. Light coffee and bourbon in the aroma. Huge flavor of bourbon, coffee and camp fire. Yes that's nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle. Medium beige head atop clear dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, coffee, some Bourbon/vanilla, milk chocolate, caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, some milk chocolate, Bourbon/vanilla, light caramel. Medium body, some stickiness.
On tap at Örebro Ölcafé. Smell of coffee and dark malts, roasted. Similar taste. Fairly light body. A bit too much coffee considering the light body.

(Modern Times City of the Dead ) Bottle 650 ml at home, received from bursprak, thanks Erik! Served into a snifter.
Black coloured body, tall and a bit thin beige head on top, with good retention.
Aroma has lots of coffee, coffee cream liquer, nice chocolate notes, light alcohol.
Taste has again plenty of coffee, cream, fudge, chocolate cake, light alcohol, mildly bitter finish.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation, smooth and creamy on the palate.
Very good.

Keg at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, London. A black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Rich roasty, malty, coffee aroma. Tastes rich, roasty, malty, coffee, some chocolate, hint of vanilla. Excellent stout.

Pitch black, medium tan frothy head, nice lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted coffee, bit ashtray, light vanilla. Taste is medium sweet chocolate, some roasted malt, coffee Merci chocolate, some coffee beans, light vanilla, dry coffee medium bitter finish and lasting aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
CBC. Black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and heavy coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish. 140516

Pours black with a foamy beige head. Aroma of rich dark roasted coffee, vanilla, roasted malts, toasted malts, vanilla, milk chocolate. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, cocoa, coffee, slight notes of bourbon, wood, bitter nuts and toasted malts. Pretty good.

Bottle shared by Rasmus. Thanks buddy :) Pours pitch black with a medium brown head. Aromas of lots of sweet coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, malt, vanilla. Taste is chocolate, roasty, bitter, vanilla, dark fruits, toasty honey wheat cereal.

Pours nearly pitch black - an extremely dark brown. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Almost outstanding, but light, nose of chocolate with a touch of coffee over a light malt base.

Light full bodied with a creamy texture that almost coats the tongue. World class carbonation / body balance that supports the creamy texture. Middle effervescence is a tickle while the finish is prickly.

The flavor profile is quite outstanding, with a bit more intensity and more complexity it would be world class. It begins with a blend of coffee and chocolate that slowly shits to coffee focused then flows to bakers chocolate focused in the middle. Neither flavor falls off the map, they just jostle for center stage. The middle provides a subtle underlying sweetness and a light coffee based bitterness. These flavors flow into the finish with chocolate receding and coffee lingering over a light oak note. I failed to detect any bourbon and vanilla was a hard find under the oak in the lingering finish. Alcohol remained completely covered.
Tap cbc. Pours black with a beige head. Coffe, roast, licorice, choko with a touch of vanilla in a good balance.

Bottle shared at Jays music&beer mixing bash. Lovely mouthfeel, gently decadent with rich creamy vanilla espresso, some brown sugar followed by lingering bourbon notes, much deeper than the abv suggests, great stuff.

Draught at CBC 2016, Green session. Devil black body. Clingy lacing, low tan-coloured head. Nose is coffee, nicely roasted. Mixed taste of coffee and cocoa powder, some impact of chocolate and oak. Long lived roasted malty bitterness to the end. Medium bodied. Likable (Copenhagen 14.05.2016).
Sampled at CBC 2016 - day 2. Roasted malts, quite a bit of coffee, chocolate, molasses.
Black pour from 22oz bottle at Lakehouse. Coffee heavy of course. Cocoa and chocolate flavor - vanilla and creamy. Super tasty

Shared bottle at RB Crete tasting at Nikos place, Chania. Pours pitch black with a big creamy tanned head. Fresh roasted coffee and dark malty aroma, whiff of bourbon. Taste is new roasted coffee, weak bitter with some dark malts, lovely sipper with very good coffee notes.

Keg @ Bishops Arms, Hornsgatan. Black with a creamy beige head, leaving rich lacing. Roasted barley aroma, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Light and thin mouthfeel. Chocolate taste with roasted notes, coffee lurking around in the background, sweet notes of vanilla and toffee.
Tap @CBC16. Clear black, creamy tan head. Coffee and roast aroma. Sweet, light coffee flavour. Light syrup and soft spice. Decent.
Tap at CBC 16. Black with a ring tan head. Big coffee nose with veggies, dark chocolate and roast. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, GREENblack. Brown roasty malty, some orang ezest on nose. Med bodied, quite easy, light feeling, dry finish. Roasty darl bready malty.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

On tap it pours a dark brown color with a medium head. The aroma has coffee up front, some vanilla and alcohol. Taste is fantastic. There is coffee first but is quickly followed with a complexity of flavors. There is raisins, butterscotch, booze and some roasted malt. Medium lacing on the glass with a great finish.

Bottle thx to Benzai, large sample. Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma of loads of coffee, roast, bit chocolate, spicyness of the coffee, some cookie and biscuit. Roasty bitterness, spicy coffee. Dont get the subtleties of the coffee being aged on bourbon, but still it is a very nice coffee stout/porter.
CBC2016. Fast schwarze Farbe, mittelgroße beige Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Kaffee, Schokolade. Geschmack süß röstmalzig, Vanille, Kaffee, Sahne.

Draft at Belmont Station. Feel like bacterial sent me one of these before, but I probably drank it without rating. Time to rectify that. Dark pour, nice head. Fantastic coffee/chocolate/vanilla/alcohol-soaked raisins and nuts. Sweet taste, roasty finish. Smooth texture, medium+ body, average carbonation. Overall: really damned good.

Bottle [from trade with Iggywh] shared with Caesar. Opaque pitch black color, medium to full sized brown head. Aroma is mostly dark malts and coffee. Only the slightest hint of bourbon, but if I didnt know it was anything bourbon, well, I wouldnt have guessed it. Taste malts, firm coffee, roast and coffee roast, moderate to medium bitter. Dont get the bourbon in the flavor at all unfortunately, would have been lovely to also get that influence.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Near black in color with a thin off white head. Roasted malty, dark chocolate, ashy notes in aroma. Flavor has sweetness, dark chocolate, nuts, chocolate cake. Solid.
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malty, breadish and slight bitter. Roasted. Dark malty and breadish. Dry and roasted finish.

Bottled 6oz. Color : heavy dark ale with nice brown head. Nose : mainly coffee (roasted malts), and alcohol. Aromas : roasted malt, coffee and honey. Medium texture, medium bitterness, low carbonation.
Pours deep black with medium brown head. Nose is roasty and coffee. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, cough syrup. Low carbonation, medium body. Medium roasty and bitter finish.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of light roast, dark malts, liquorice. Taste is more of the same. Creamy texture, roasted bitterness.

On keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate with a creamy chocolate persistent note. Light coffee.
Taste - coffee up front and then tonnes of dry chocolate. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long balanced finish. 
Overall - luscious.

Bottle shared. Deep brown to black with a half a finger of beige foam that lingers. Huge espresso forward nose with bourbon, light oak and chocolate. Oaky flavors with roasted cacao. Creamy mouthfeel and feels much more complex for the abv and for not being barrel-aged (well the coffee is so I guess thats whats going on). Smooth as silk on the finish with lingering coffee and light bourbon and vanilla.

On tap at brewdog pub Edinburgh. Pours deep brown color, beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, nuts, dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, nuts.
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black, nose is wood, chocolate, toffee, roasted, taste is similar.
UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Keg at brew dog... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet coffee chocolate roast malts nose.. Dark roast.. Big coffee.. Rich chocolate roast.. Over fizzy

22 ounce bottle purchased at The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma on this has light roasted coffee character along with a little anise. Nicely quaffable. Essentially opaque dark mahogany body with a medium, fizzy cream-colored head. Starts with a very light unsweetened chocolate goodness, before a rich, moderately roasted coffee flavor comes through. Light bitterness to finish. Not ashy, and amazingly non-astringent. The mouthfeel on this is just fantastic. A fucking amazing beer.

Bomber from Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, earthy coffee, peanuts, dark malt. Med body at least. Flavor is coffee, chocolate, dark malt, peanuts, arguably some bourbon aspects. Mostly coffee.
Draught. Dlack with a tan head. Aroma is a lot of coffee and vanilla. Flavour is chocolate and coffee, dry sweet milk finish.
Bottle - dark pour and a tan head. Heavy, heavy, HEAVY coffee aroma and taste. Good mix of coffee and dark chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel and a mild detection of alcohol.

Keg at Brewdog Glasgow Westendtonditch. Pours almost opaque black with a medium light brown head. Aroma is strong and packing with coffee, vanilla, and oak. Taste is chocolate sweet, caramel sweet, huge fruity coffee notes, vanilla, oak, raisins, chocolate milkshake. This chocolate milkshake brought me to the yard.

Draught at Harrys Hofbrau. Booze, vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Black with light brown head that only stays as a collar. Taste is rich and complex malt, with a roasted bitter finish. Bourbon barrel shows in moderate low amounts. Semi-dry.

Pours black with a khaki head. Rich dark roast coffee, roasted malt and more coffee aroma. Rich dark roast coffee, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee flavors. Medium full body with average carbonation. Roasted coffee finish.
Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is spent coffee and rich dark malts. Big roasted, bourbon soaked coffee. Strong and straightforward.
22oz bottle pours a thick black color with a lot of head. Rich coffee flavors without coffee bitterness. Some nice hops to balance.
22 ounce bottle from Blackwells. Dark pour. Light mouthfeel with light coffee. Some chocolate. Fairly good overall.

Pint poured from tap at waypoint public house in San Diego. Pours dark brown with a minimal beige head. Smell is complex. I got chocolate and smoke at first with a touch of coffee. Taste is also complicated. Come sin strong with smoke then hits you with a touch of chocolate and some bitter and alcohol to finish. Very good beer.

I am generally happy with this spl bear from land of whale vagina...perhaps ballast point has competitor wit less marketing but simpal supar quality nonetheless. From a 22 oz bottle; this is a relatively light-bodied flavorful stout with a simpler flavor profile than the deScription would suggest. Notes of coffee and chocolate are very restrained. The texture is nice and creamy. If under 6% ABV, it would be outstanding; at 7.5% it has a lot of competition.

Intriguing concoction! Aroma off the charts! Bourbon and coffee... why not! Thin palate coveys a bit of a mixed bag of jumbled flavors that may or may not belong together. Great experiment and Im rating relatively hight on this one! 22oz bottle

Black pour, tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma is strong coffee, light barrel character, darker chocolate. Medium bodied, choco coffee flavor dominates with some barrel character. Interesting process in its creation, but its just a coffee stout with light barrel characteristics.

On tap at the brewery. It pours a very dark brown/black color with a tan head. The aroma is creamy with cocoa, nuts, coffee and hints of vanilla and marshmallow. The flavor is more smoky with a relatively light body. Almost burnt in the finish but creamy on the palate. Some hints of almond skins. Lots of smoke and chocolaty coffee in the finish. Good stuff.

Bottle, black beer decent walnut head faded. Aroma chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Taste is cookies and coffee, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, brown sugar, dark fruit. Palate is smooth, carb moderate. This is a little sweet, but I love the flavors! Its super!

Rating from notes. Bomber from trade. Dark pour with minimal head. Aroma is mostly coffee and roasty malts. Tastes follows, a little more dry and roasty than I like but still really drinkable and good.

Draught at Lomaland Fermentorium. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy tan head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is earthy coffee, chocolate, oak, light Bourbon, prunes and molasses. Flavor is rich chocolate and bold earthy coffee, oak, Bourbon, prunes and roast malt with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Bomber bottle shared at OConnors. Black with tan head. Aroma has vanilla, coffee, roasted malt, grass and dark chocolate. Taste is similar, full bodied, complex and smooth. Vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, burnt and roasted malts with a chocolatey bitter finish.

Small frothy light-brown head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing. Flat thick black body. Aroma: strong coffee, alcohol, heavy toasted malt, bourbon, oak. Initial flavor: moderate sweet (coffee and malty). Final flavor: moderate sweet light bitter (espresso-like); long duration. Palate: medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation and moderate alcoholic finish. Espresso bem presente no paladar. Aquecimento alcoólico lembra bourbon. Acima da média. Notas salgadas no final. 150s

1PT bottle at THE BEER MASONS.
Dark colored with small head, wanted to have a chocolate bar before the beer, no need anymore after tasting this amazing stout.
Strong with hints of bourbon.

(Bottle, 0.65 l, at tiongs tasting, thanks tiong, 20160109) The beer poured black. Its head was quite large and lightly brown. Aroma had vanilla, coffee and dark chocolate. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, burnt malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and bitter. Nice balance of burnt brew and coffee.

January 22, 2016. Bottle. 
Black with a small, frothy tan head. Aroma is creamy coffee with vanilla and toffee hints, bourbon, milk chocolate, licorice and toffee. 
Taste is light to medium sweet, malty, soft bitter. Finish is creamy and bitter roasted coffee with vanilla, milk chocolate, bourbon, hints of licorice, 
Medium bodied, creamy and light oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Goes down very smooth, creamy coffee notes with a touch of bourbon and chocolate. Great!

650ml bottle (tasting @tiongs, thanks). Pitch black color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, coffee, roast, raisins, plums in aroma. Deep roast, milky, dark chocolate, prunes in taste. Long lasting deep roast in aftertaste. Smooth and delicate texture. Pleasure to drink. Fantastic brew.

650ml bottle - thanks tiong and the rest of the posse at tiongs!
Thin aroma, definitely needs to warm. Very dark, small tan tight head. Opens nicely - a rich roast, but gentle coffee and chocolate cake too. Tastes the same. Finish a bit dry and dusty, but pleasantly bitter. Really fills out as it warms, gets a bit sweeter but never sticky, in the aroma, and nuttier in the finish. No signs of alcohol the whole time, even though there was a tantalisingly tiny hint of bourbon barrels occasionally. Damn fine stout.

22 oz bottle. Courtesy of tiong. 
Black color with a small light tan head. 
Coffee, sweetness, cardboard dryness, vegetables and some milky sweetness in the aroma.
The flavor is coffee, some milky sweetness, mild sourness, mild bitterness and mildly roasted malt. Surprisingly good for a coffee beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle, thanks Sami!
Pours pitch black with a smooth white head. Aroma of coffee, roasty malts, vanilla, hints of dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, slick and slightly roasty with loads of coffee, hints of wood, vanilla, dark chocolate and cocoa. Finish is smooth, slick and slightly roasty with loads of coffee, vanilla, cocoa and hints of wood. Quite smooth and pretty tasty. Not much bourbon here though.

Bottle tiongs, Espoo. Thanks tiong! Colour is almost black with very small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, some vanilla, some wood, distant hints of bourbon (maybe imagination), some chocolate and roasted malts. Quite soft and enjoyable.

Dark brown color, dark brown head. Very intense coffee nose with the bourbon really shining with tons of roasted malt character and molasses. Big bourbon notes in the mouth but not really has much alcohol burn, lots of dark fruit, dark chocolate notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Excellent

Pours a very dark brown with a ra head. A pleasant whiff of coffee, vanilla, dark malt. The taste is mild, roasted malts and light coffee, oak, and a little dryness at the end. It feels quite light-bodied, not rich and full, but delivers on flavour pretty well, nice coffee notes.
Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a dark brown with paperthin beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong roast, cocoa, wood. Medium mouth, roast, cocoa, light dryness, good.

Sample at SBWF 2015. 

Almost black with a tan head. Coffee, light oak, chocolate and some light vanilla. Also bourbon. Medium body and with a smooth mouthfeel. Quite tasty.

Aroma is lovely from coffee, vanilla, slight bourbon and sweet chocolates. Taste is awesome, a little dry and ashy, but still sweet and creamy. Coffee, vanilla fudge, wood, and sweet candy. A superb dessert stout. A reasonable price makes me wanna stock up on this baby. Awesome!

Sampled February 2015
A steady pour into my glass produces a two-finger thick, creamy textured, brown tinged, dark tan colored head. The beer is a concentrated brown, almost black color that is opaque when held up to the light. The aroma is quite interesting, clearly dominated by the coffee, but it is so smooth, mellow, despite being pervasive, with a smooth coffee melding fruitiness (is this the Bourbon Barrel influence), somewhat green smelling, a bit woody, but with lots of toasted, caramelized, dark nut leaning, smooth roasted coffee character. Supporting notes of toasted / roasted, whole grain bread, Nut accentuating malt notes, and perhaps a touch of cocoa character are contributed by the malt.

Lightly sweet up front, the beer finishes dry and roasted though. The body is quite light, even for a beer of this strength, and the bitter, roasted, astringent notes in this beer seem to lighten up the medium body that would be here otherwise. The finish has a lingering, bitter, woody, astringent, not quite charcoal character to it, that begs you to take another. Up front there are soft, dark chocolate notes, burnt nut flavors, smoother roasted caramelized coffee notes, toasted brown sugar (without any real sweetness), and rounded, dusty cocoa flavors. 

This is an interesting beer, the unique coffee character comes out more in the nose than it does in the flavor; in fact the Bourbon barrel itself (Bourbon and woody oak) seems distinguishably noticeable in the nose, while it is more of a suggestion in the flavor. This is definitely an experience, but in the end it is a bit too dominated by the coffee (I would prefer more of the rich Stout to have more of a say here) for my personal preference, but I am definitely interested to try this coffee at some point.

Ive been looking at this bottle for a long while; it sat patiently in my cellar, cool as a cucumber and taunted me every day with the words on the bottle...coffee, oak, bourbon; certainly a craft beer trifecta!
The beer is opened, the aroma is coffee with a bite. A well tempered bourbon is aromatically apparent in the air above the glass as I pour, and a rich latte colored head rises and caps the deep brown liquid. I can see it is short-lived, soft and permeable.
The glass tips, the beer wets my bottom lip and I draw my first sip, breathing in as I pull the beer over my tongue. The bourbon turns to a hot vanilla on the nose and I feel a tightness on my gums as the liquid streams through my mouth. A roasted coffee flavor comes around, more deeply as I sip, the dryness appropriate to the flavor but a slight bitterness comes at me from behind. I find the higher temperature adds a bit of chocolate to the flavor profile and the combination becomes even more sophisticated as times wears on.
The foam atop the beer is slight at this point, and leaves wet traces of itself on the glass. Not lacing, more like stretch marks...
A moderate body with a comfortable level of carbonation helps the flavor punctuate the sultry bourbon taste and the short, but exceedingly sexy finish. A very nice experience, and one I would have as often as possible. If Modern Times wanted to send me one of everything...Id have this twice. Yes. Thank you very much.

22 ounce bottle into snifter; no bottle dating, but is a recent release. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 2 finger dense and rocky tan head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice desne soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toffee, toast, dark bread, nuttiness, vanilla, light bourbon, smoke/char, herbal, floral, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roast/bready malt, coffee, and light earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toffee, toast, dark bread, nuttiness, vanilla, light bourbon, smoke/char, herbal, floral, and roasted earthiness. Good amount of roast/char and herbal hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toffee, toast, dark bread, nuttiness, vanilla, light bourbon, smoke char, herbal, floral, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent coffee Foreign stout style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

The cocoa, coffee, and malts impart their aromas and flavors harmoniously. While Id like to get some bourbon-like vanilla notes, I love this beers depth of taste and lack of bitterness. Id love to see some more variants of this Stout. Modern Times has crafted a supremely drinkable Foreign Stout.

22 oz bottle acquired via trade on BA. Thanks, bro! An extra from a large sour focused trade, this is very welcomed. Pours a thicker blackish opaque pour, brownish ruby glow emanates from the bottom and edges. Cakey brownish head atop stays as a decent firm layer, good retention and lacing overall. Aromas are richly and decadently coffee laden. Firm roasty and earth meet jabs of fruit, touches of wood and espresso. Distinct dark fruit and sweet quality comes into play, caramel and toffee meet plum and a waft of black cherry. Firmer nuttiness, toast, and toffee meet some luscious vanilla smoothed out sweetness. Initial is medium bodied, a bit more full as silky vanilla, creamy malts, espresso glide over the palate. Nutty malts, coffee and gentle oak meet some creaminess, vanilla and toasty carmelized glow. Nougat, chopped nuts and rich espresso and coffee depth pervade the senses. Cocoa nibs, rich coffee character is roasty, nutty and just lovely. A firmer roasty backend as we get past the barrel and silky sweeter malts up front. Back is dry, bitter, toasty and cocoa nibs. Touches of ash and roast, earth and coffee ground bitterness taper out. While a firmer stout base, the coffee and additions here transform this, making this glide over the palate at times without getting away from that distinct and yearned for coffee/roasty complexity and bitterness as we finish. This is just lovely stuff without being too big or brooding. A beer that integrates the coffee well, lets it shine at times. This is a gem as far as Im concerned. Well done!

Strong aromas of strange coffee, earthy roast, roasted dark malts,barrel wood and harsh nuttiness. Appears a solid black with a thin mocha rim and subtle lace. Taste follows nose bringing funky coffee upfront, espresso oils, coffee bean oils, earthy dry roasted malts, bitter chocolate, dark grain malts, roasted caramel, subtle oak and very hinted bourbon. Pour from a bomber into a Teku glass. Dark black pour with a really nice thick tan head. Awesome nose on this beer: A hint of bourbon, sweet cafe au lait with a hint of caramel. One of the best aromas Ive smelled in a beer, the taste is very good but does not live up to the nose (at least for me). Massive coffee flavor. Seriously, skip the morning coffee and just go straight for this. The sweetness I found in the nose is nowhere in the taste. Some nice coffee bitterness and roasted malt in the finish. Very interesting. Bourbon way, way on the backend (and by back end, I mean just a slight warmth remaining in your mouth a minute after you taste it). If you are a coffee geek, you will love this beer.
